title: How to Set Up Gaming on Linux
description: Complete guide to gaming on Linux. Install Steam, enable Proton, and play Windows games.
prerequisites: Ubuntu, Pop!_OS, or Linux Mint recommended

steps.title: Install Graphics Drivers
steps.content: For NVIDIA GPUs, install proprietary drivers. For AMD, the open-source drivers work great out of the box.
steps.code:
# For NVIDIA (Ubuntu/Pop!_OS)
sudo ubuntu-drivers autoinstall

# Then reboot
sudo reboot

steps.title: Install Steam
steps.content: Install Steam from your distribution's repository or download from steam website:

steps.title: Enable Steam Play (Proton)
steps.content:
In Steam, go to **Settings â†’ Compatibility** and check:

- Enable Steam Play for supported titles
- Enable Steam Play for all other titles

Select the latest Proton version from the dropdown.

steps.title: Install Gamemode (Optional)
steps.content: Gamemode optimizes your system while gaming:

steps.title: Install MangoHud (Optional)
steps.content: MangoHud provides an in-game overlay showing FPS, CPU/GPU stats:

steps.title: Test a Game
steps.content: Try installing a Windows game from your Steam library. Check ProtonDB (protondb.com) to see compatibility ratings and any tweaks needed for specific games.

seo.title: Gaming on Linux Setup Guide | Steam & Proton
seo.description: Set up Linux for gaming. Install Steam, enable Proton, configure drivers. Play Windows games on Linux with this complete guide.
